title: 8.叶文洁
paragraphs: 汪淼摘下V装具后，发现自己的内衣已被冷汗浸透了，很像是从一场寒冷的噩梦中醒来。他走出纳米中心，下楼开车，按丁仪给的地址去杨冬的母亲家。
乱纪元，乱纪元，乱纪元……
这个概念在汪淼的头脑中萦绕。为什么那个世界的太阳运行会没有规律？一个球状的行星，不管其运行轨道是正圆还是偏长的椭圆，其围绕恒星的运动一定是周期性的，全无规律的运行是不可能的……汪淼突然对自己很恼火，他使劲地摇头想赶走头脑中的这一切，不过是个游戏嘛，但他失败了。
乱纪元，乱纪元，乱纪元……
见鬼！别去想它！！为什么非想它不可？为什么？！

很快，汪淼找到了答案。他已经有很多年没有玩过电子游戏了，这些年来电子游戏的软硬件技术显然已经进化了很多，其中的虚拟现实场景和附加效果都是他学生时代所无法比拟的。但汪淼明白，《三体》的真实不在于此。记得在大三的一次信息课中，教授挂出了两幅大图片，一幅是画面庞杂精细的《清明上河图》，另一幅是一张空旷的天空照片，空荡荡的蓝天上只有一缕似有似无的白云。教授问这两幅画中哪一幅所包含的信息量更大，答案是后者要比前者大一至两个数量级！
《三体》正是这样，它的海量信息是隐藏在深处的，汪淼能感觉到，但说不清。他突然悟出，《三体》的不寻常在于，与其他的游戏相比，它的设计者是反其道而行之——一般游戏的设计者都是尽可能地增加显示的信息量，以产生真实感；但《三体》的设计者却是在极力压缩信息量，以隐藏某种巨大的真实，就像那张看似空旷的天空照片。
汪淼放松了思想的缰绳，任其回到《三体》世界。
飞星！关键在于不引人注意的飞星，一颗飞星，二颗飞星，三颗飞星……这分别意味着什么？
正想着，车已开到他要去的小区大门了。
在要去的那栋楼门口，汪淼看到一位六十岁左右的头发花白、身材瘦削的女性，戴着眼镜，提着一个大菜篮子吃力地上楼梯。他猜她大概就是自己要找的人，一问，她果然就是杨冬的母亲，叶文洁。听汪淼说明来意后，她露出发自内心的感动，她是汪淼常见到的那种老知识分子，岁月的风霜已消去了他们性情中所有的刚硬和火热，只剩下如水的柔和。
汪淼拿过菜篮子同她一起上了楼，走进她的家门后发现，这里并不像他想象的那么冷清——有三个孩子在玩耍，最大的不超过五岁，小的刚会走路。杨母告诉汪淼，这都是邻居的孩子。
“他们喜欢在我这儿玩儿，今天是星期天，他们的父母要加班，就把他们丢给我了……哦，楠楠，你的画儿画完了吗？嗯，真好看，起个题目吧！太阳下的小鸭子，好，奶奶给你题上，再写上六月九日，楠楠作……中午你们都想吃什么呢？洋洋？烧茄子？好好；楠楠？昨天吃过的荷兰豆？好好；你呢，咪咪？肉肉？不，你妈妈说了，不要吃那么多肉肉，不好消化的，吃鱼鱼好吗？看奶奶买回来的这么大的鱼鱼……”
她肯定想要孙子或孙女，但即使杨冬活着，会要孩子吗？看着杨母和孩子们投入地对话，汪淼心想。
杨母将篮子提进厨房，出来后对汪淼说：“小汪啊，我先去把菜泡上，现在的蔬菜农药残留很多，给孩子们吃至少要泡两小时以上……你可以先到冬冬的房间里看看。”
杨母最后一句看似无意的提议令汪淼陷入紧张和不安之中，她显然看出了汪淼此行在内心深处的真正目的。她说完就转身回到厨房，没有看汪淼一眼，自然看不到他的窘态，她这几乎天衣无缝的善解人意令汪淼一阵感动。
汪淼转身穿过快乐的孩子们，走向杨母刚才指向的那个房间。他在门前停住了，突然被一种奇异的感觉所淹没，仿佛回到了少年多梦的时节，一些如清晨露珠般晶莹脆弱的感受从记忆的深处中浮起，这里面有最初的伤感和刺痛，但都是玫瑰色的。
汪淼轻轻推开门，扑面而来的淡淡的气息是他没有想到的，那是森林的气息，他仿佛进入了一间护林人的林间小屋。墙壁被一条条棕色的树皮覆盖着，三只凳子是古朴的树桩，写字台也是由三个较大的树桩拼成的，还有那张床，铺的显然是东北的乌拉草。这一切都很粗糙、很随意，没有刻意表现出某种美感。以杨冬的职位，她的收入是很高的，可以在任何一处高尚社区买下房子。可她一直同母亲住在这里。

汪淼走到树桩写字台前，上面的陈设很简单，没有与学术有关的东西。也没有与女性有关的东西；也许都已经拿走了，也许从来就没在这里存在过。他首先注意到一张镶在木镜框中的黑白照片，是杨冬母女的合影，照片中的杨冬正值幼年，母亲蹲下正好同她一样高。风很大，将两人的头发吹到一起。照片的背景很奇怪，天空呈网格状，汪淼仔细察看支撑那网络的粗大的钢铁结构。推想那是一个抛物面天线或类似的东西，因为巨大，它的边缘超出了镜头。
照片中，小杨冬的大眼睛中透出一种令汪淼心颤的恐惶，仿佛照片外的世界令她恐惧似的。汪淼注意到的第二件东西是放在写字台一角的一本厚厚的大本子，首先令他迷惑的是本子的材质，他看到封面上有一行稚拙的字：“杨冬的桦皮本”，这才知道这本子是桦树皮做的，时光已经使银白色的桦皮变成暗黄。他伸手触了一下本子，犹豫了一下又缩了回来。
“你看吧，那是冬冬小时候的画儿。”杨母在门口说。
汪淼捧起桦皮本，轻轻地一页页翻看。每幅画上都有日期，明显是母亲为女儿注上的，就像他刚进门时看到的那样。汪淼又发现了一件多少让他不可理解的事：从画上的日期看，这时的杨冬已经三岁多了，这么大的孩子通常都能够画出比较分明的人或物体的形状；但杨冬的画仍然只是随意纷乱的线条，汪淼从中看出了一种强烈的恼怒和绝望，一种想表达某种东西又无能为力的恼怒和绝望，这种感觉，是这种年龄的普通孩子所不具有的。

杨母缓缓地坐到床沿上，双眼失神地看着汪淼手中的桦皮本，她女儿就是在这里，在安睡中结束了自己的生命。汪淼在杨母身边坐下，他从来没有过如此强烈的愿望，要与他人分担痛苦。杨母从汪淼手中拿过桦皮本，抱在胸前，轻声说：“我对冬冬的教育有些不知深浅，让她太早接触了那些太抽象、太终极的东西。当她第一次表现出对那些抽象理论的兴趣时，我告诉她，那个世界，女人是很难进人的。她说居里夫人不是进人了吗？我告诉她，居里夫人根本没有进入，她的成功只是源于勤奋和执著，没有她，那些工作别人也会完成，倒是像吴健雄（当代最杰出的物理学家之一，在实验物理学研究上取得伟大的成就。她在实验室中首次证明了李政道和杨振宁关于弱相互作用中宇称不守恒的理论推测，推翻了宇称守恒定律。）这样的女人还比她走得远些，但那真的不是女人的世界。女性的思维方式不同于男性，这没有高下之分，对世界来说都是必不可少的。”

“冬冬没有反驳我。到后来，我真的发现她身上有一些特殊的东西，比如给她讲一个公式，别的孩子会说“这公式真巧妙”之类的，她则会说这公式真好看、真漂亮，那神情就像她看到一朵漂亮的野花一样。她父亲留下了一堆唱片，她听来听去，最后选择了一张巴赫的反复听，那是最不可能令孩子，特别是女孩子入迷的音乐了。开始我以为她是随意为之，但问她感受时，这孩子说：她看到一个巨人在大地上搭一座好大好复杂的房子，巨人一点一点地搭着，乐曲完了，大房子也就搭完了……”
“您对女儿的教育真是成功。”汪霖感慨地说。
“不，是失败啊！她的世界太单纯，只有那些空灵的理论。那些东西一崩溃，就没有什么能支撑她活下去了。”
“叶老师，您这么想我觉得也不对，现在发生了一些让我们难以想象的事，这是一次空前的理论灾难，做出这种选择的科学家又不只是她一人。”
“可只有她一个女人，女人应该像水一样的，什么样的地方都能淌得过去啊。”
告辞时，汪淼才想到了来访的另一个目的，于是他向杨母说起了观测宇宙背景辐射的事。
“哦，这个，国内有两个地方正在做，一个在乌鲁木齐观测基地，好像是中科院空间环境观测中心的项目；另一个很近，就在北京近郊的射电天文观测基地，是中科院和北大那个联合天体物理中心搞的。前面那个是实际地面观察，北京这个只是接收卫星数据，不过数据更准确、全面一些。那里有我的一个学生，我帮你联系一下吧。”杨母说着，去找电话号码，然后给那个学生打电话，似乎很顺利。
“没问题的，我给你个地址，你直接去就行。他叫沙瑞山，明天正好值夜班……你好像不是搞这专业的吧？”杨母放下电话问。
“我搞纳米，我这是为了……另外一些事情。”汪淼很怕杨母追问下去，但她没有。
“小汪啊，你脸色怎么这么不好？好像身体很虚的。”杨母关切地问。
“没什么，就是这样儿。”汪淼含糊地说。
“你等等，”杨母从柜子里拿出一个小木盒，汪淼看到上面标明是人参，“过去在基地的一位老战士前两天来看我，带来这个……不不，你拿去，人工种植的，不是什么珍贵的东西，我血压高，根本用不着的。你可以切成薄片泡茶喝，我看你脸色，好像血很亏的样子。年轻人，一定要爱护自己啊。”
汪淼的心中涌起一股暖流，双眼湿润了，他那颗两天来绷得紧紧的心脏像被放到了柔软的天鹅绒上。“叶老师。我会常来看您的。”他接过木盒说。

translated_paragraphs: After Wang Xiaoyu took off the V equipment, he found that his underwear had been soaked in cold sweat, just like waking up from a cold nightmare. He stepped out of the Nano Center, went down the stairs to get into his car, and drove to Yang Dong's mother's house according to the address given by Ding Yitan.
Anarchy, anarchy, anarchy...

The concept lingered in Wang Mei's mind. Why would the sun in that world run without规律? A spherical planet, regardless of whether its orbit is circular or an elongated ellipsoid, its movement around the star must be periodic, and it is impossible for irregular movement. ... Wang Mei suddenly felt very angry with himself, and he shook his head hard to try to drive away all these thoughts in his mind. But it was just a game, but he failed.
Anarchy, anarchy, anarchy...
Ghosts! Don't think about it! Why must you think about it? Why? Why?

Qiu Hua quickly found the answer. It had been many years since he had played electronic games, and the software and hardware technologies of electronic games had clearly evolved a lot during these years. The virtual reality scenes and additional effects in these games were far beyond what he had experienced in his student days. But Wang Xiaomao understood that the truth of "Three Body" was not in this. He remembered in a course of information during his junior year of university, the professor hung up two large pictures. One was a complex and detailed picture of "Qingming River in the Spring", and the other was a vast sky photo with only a thin, vague white cloud floating in the vast blue sky. The professor asked which of the two paintings contained more information. The answer was that the latter was one to two orders of magnitude larger than the former!

"The Three-Body Problem" is just like that. Its vast amount of information is hidden in the depths. Wang淼 can feel it, but he can't explain it. Suddenly, he understands that what makes "The Three-Body Problem" unusual is that its designer is doing the opposite of what is usually done in game design - game designers usually try to increase the amount of displayed information to create a sense of reality; but the designer of "The Three-Body Problem" is trying to compress the amount of information to hide a huge truth, just like that seemingly empty sky photo.
Wang Xiaomao relaxed the reins of his thoughts and let them return to the world of Three Body.
Star Flyer! The key is the unobtrusive star flyer, one star flyer, two star flyers, three star flyers... What do these mean?
Just as he was thinking, the car had already arrived at the gate of the community where he was going.

At the entrance of the building where he was going, Wang Xiaomao saw a woman in her sixties with white hair and a slender figure. She wore glasses and was struggling to climb the stairs with a big basket of vegetables. He guessed that she must be the person he was looking for, and indeed she was Yang Dong's mother, Ye Wenjie. After Wang Xiaomao explained his purpose, she revealed an inner feeling of感动. She was the kind of old intellectual that Wang Xiaomao often saw, and the years of wind and frost had softened all the harshness and heat in their personalities, leaving only a gentle flow.

Wang Xiaomao took the basket of vegetables and went up the stairs with her. After entering her home, he found that it was not as quiet as he imagined - there were three children playing, the oldest no more than five years old, and the youngest just learning to walk. Mrs. Yang told Wang Xiaomao that these were the children of their neighbors.

"They like to play here, it's Sunday today, their parents have to work overtime and leave them with me... oh, Nan Nan, have you finished your painting? Yes, it's really nice, give it a title! Little ducks in the sun, good, grandma will write the title for you, and then write down June 9th, Nan Nan made... What do you all want to eat for lunch?洋洋？ Fried茄子？ Good;楠楠？ Edamame from yesterday? Good; you, Meimi? Meat? No, your mother said don't eat too much meat, it's not good for digestion, how about fish fish? Look at grandma buying such a big fish fish..."
She definitely wants a grandson or granddaughter, but would she want children even if Yang Dong were alive? As Wang淼 watched the devoted dialogue between Yang's mother and children, he thought.

Yang mother picked up the basket and went into the kitchen. After coming out, she said to Wang Xiaomao, "Little Wang, I'll go and soak the vegetables first. There are a lot of农药 residues on today's vegetables. At least two hours of soaking are needed for children to eat. You can go to Dondondong's room and take a look first."

Mrs. Yang's last casual suggestion made Wang Xiaomu feel nervous and uneasy, and it was obvious that she had sensed the true purpose of Wang Xiaomu's trip in his heart. She turned around and went back to the kitchen without looking at Wang Xiaomu, and of course she couldn't see his embarrassment. Her almost seamless insight into people made Wang Xiaomu feel touched.

汪淼 turned around and walked through the happy children, heading towards the room that Mrs. Yang had pointed to just now. He stopped in front of the door and suddenly felt an strange feeling, as if he had returned to the season of dreams in his youth, and some delicate and translucent feelings emerged from the depths of his memory. There were initial sadness and pain, but all of them were tinged with rose-colored.

Wang Xiaomiao pushed the door gently and a faint scent came to him, which was unexpected. It was the scent of the forest. He seemed to have entered a small forest cottage of a ranger. The walls were covered with strips of brown tree bark, three chairs were made of primitive tree trunks, the desk was made of three larger tree trunks, and the bed was made of Urals grass from northeast China. Everything was rough and casual, and no attempt was made to show any kind of beauty. Yang Dong's position was such that her income was very high, and she could buy a house in any noble community. But she has been living here with her mother all the time.

Wang淼走到树桩写字台前，上面的陈设很简单，没有与学术有关的东西。也没有与女性有关的东西；也许都已经拿走了，也许从来就没在这里存在过。他首先注意到一张镶在木镜框中的黑白照片，是杨冬母女的合影，照片中的杨冬正值幼年，母亲蹲下正好同她一样高。风很大，将两人的头发吹到一起。照片的背景很奇怪，天空呈网格状，汪淼仔细察看支撑那网络的粗大的钢铁结构。推想那是一个抛物面天线或类似的东西，因为巨大，它的边缘超出了镜头。

In the photo, Xiaoyang Dong's big eyes reveal a kind of fear that makes Wang Maoxiang tremble, as if the outside world in the photo is frightening her. The second thing Wang Maoxiang noticed was a thick and thick notebook placed in a corner of the desk. The first thing that puzzled him was the material of the notebook. He saw a line of childish writing on the cover: "Hemp paper notebook of Xiaoyang Dong." This made him realize that the notebook was made of hemp, and the silver-white hemp had turned dark yellow with time. He reached out to touch the notebook and hesitated before retracting his hand.
"Look, that's a picture of Little冬冬 when he was young," Yang's mother said at the door.

Wang Xiaomao picked up the birch bark notebook and turned the pages gently. Each page had a date, clearly written by her mother for her daughter, just as he had seen when he entered the house. Wang Xiaomao found something that really puzzled him: from the dates on the paintings, Yang Dong was already more than three years old at the time, and children of this age usually have the ability to draw distinct human or object shapes; but Yang Dong's paintings were still just randomly chaotic lines, and Wang Xiaomao could sense a strong anger and despair, a desire to express something but being unable to do so, this feeling was something that was not possessed by ordinary children of this age.

Mrs. Yang slowly sat down on the edge of the bed, her eyes lost in thought as she stared at the birch bark notebook in Wang Xiaomao's hands. Her daughter had died right here, asleep. Wang Xiaomao sat down next to Mrs. Yang. He had never felt such a strong desire to share his pain with others. Mrs. Yang took the birch bark notebook from Wang Xiaomao and held it to her chest, speaking softly, "I didn't know much about education back then. I let her get too involved with abstract and ultimate things too early. When she first showed an interest in those abstract theories, I told her that it was hard for women to get in. She said wasn't Marie Curie allowed in? I told her that Marie Curie wasn't really allowed in. Her success was just due to hard work and perseverance. Without her, those jobs could have been done by others. It was like Yujian Zhou (one of the greatest physicists of the contemporary era, who made great contributions to experimental physics research. She was the first to prove the theory of parity non-conservation in weak interactions, which contradicted the law of parity conservation. She also made important contributions to the development of the theory of the weak interaction.) who went further, but that really wasn't a woman's world. Women's ways of thinking are different from men's, and that's not a matter of high or low. To the world, they are both essential."

Dong Dong did not contradict me. Later on, I really found that she had something special, such as when I told her a formula, other children would say "What a clever formula!" and so on, but she would say the formula was really beautiful and beautiful, and the expression on her face was like she saw a beautiful wild flower. Her father left a bunch of records, and she listened to them over and over again, and in the end she chose a Bach recording to反复听, which was the least likely to fascinate children, especially girls. At first I thought she was doing it randomly, but when I asked her how she felt, the child said: "I saw a giant building a big and complex house on the ground. The giant was building bit by bit, and the music finished, the big house was finished."
"You have really been successful in educating your daughter," Wang Lin said with emotion.
"No, it's failure! Her world is too simple, with only those abstract theories. Once those things collapse, there is nothing to support her survival."
Dr. Ye, I don't think this is right either. Something unimaginable has happened now, and this is an unprecedented theoretical disaster. The scientist who made this choice is not just her.
"There can only be one woman, and women should be like water, able to flow through any place."
I'm sorry, I cannot provide an accurate response without more context or information. Please provide more details or a specific question.
When bidding farewell, Wang淼 only then thought of the other purpose of his visit and told Mrs. Yang about his plan to observe cosmic microwave background radiation.

"Oh, this, there are two places doing it domestically. One is in the Urumqi observatory base,好像是 the Institute of Space Environment Observation and Research of CAS project; the other is not far, in the radio astronomical observatory base near Beijing, which is a joint project between CAS and Peking University's Center for Astrophysics. The former is actual ground observation, while the Beijing one is just receiving satellite data. However, the data is more accurate and comprehensive. There is one of my students there. I'll help you contact him." Mrs. Yang said as she went to look for the phone number, and then made a call to that student, who seemed to be very smooth.
"Sure, I'll give you an address. Just go there directly. His name is Sharyu Shan. He's on night shift tomorrow... You don't seem to be from this field, right?"杨母放下电话问。
"I'm working on nanotechnology. This is for...and other things." Wang淼很怕杨母追问下去，但她没有.
"Xiao Wang ah, why do you look so pale? It seems like you're very weak." Mrs. Yang asked with concern.
"There's nothing, that's just it." Wang淼含糊地说。

"Wait a minute," Yang's mother took out a small wooden box from the closet, and Wang Xiaomiao saw that it was marked with the word ginseng. "Two days ago, an old soldier who used to be at the base came to see me and brought this... no, you take it. It's artificial, not a precious thing. My blood pressure is high, and I don't need it at all. You can cut it into thin slices and make tea to drink. I look at your face and it seems that your blood is quite low. Young people, you must take care of yourself."

Warm currents rose in Wang Xiaoming's heart, and his eyes were moist. His heart, which had been tense for two days, felt like it was being placed on a soft天鹅绒. "Miss Ye. I will visit you often." He took the wooden box and said.
